Navigation
Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/Number/Conditional
Synopsis Conditional expression for numeric values.
Syntax Exp1 ? Exp2 : Exp3
Types
Exp1 Exp2 Exp3 Exp1 ? Exp2 : Exp3
bool int int int
bool int real real
bool real real real
Description If the value of Exp is true then the value of Exp1 else the value of Exp2.
Examples 
rascal>(3 > 2) ? 10 : 20
int: 10
rascal>(3 > 20) ? 10 : 20
int: 20

Questions
Question [1].
The type of (-16 > 11) ? -5 : 10 is

Question [2].
The type of (-9 > -20) ? -12.985092892188405600 : 18.63755696027145600 is

Question [3].
The type of (-13 > -13) ? -14 : 19.4362330490806000 is

Question [4]. 
(-2 > 19) ? -17 : 8 ==

Question [5]. 
(-19 > -19) ? 0 : -5.49957219079718000 ==
